newsitem.title: USA: Canada spot propane weakens in slow trade.
newsitem.headline: Canada spot propane weakens in slow trade.

text.p: Canada spot propane prices dipped for the second consecutive week, pressured by slow trade and renewed confidence in stocks, players said on Thursday.
Weaker values in the U.S. hubs also helped lower Canada prices, traders added.
In the Eastern Canadian hub of Sarnia, spot propane dropped about 1.25 cents a gallon during the week to between 52.50/53.00 cents in quiet trade.
"Inventories are starting to look pretty good for eastern Canada now," said one player, noting last month's nearly 14 percent stock build.
In the Western hub of Edmonton, spot material fell one cent to 44.00/44.50 cents. The region had 23.5 percent stock build last month.
Sarnia normal butane, however, remained largely unchanged at 48.50/49.00 cents amid tight supplies.
A transportation symposium sponsored this week by the National Propane Association of Canada dampened activity, players added.
